exogenous_noise_impact.impact: High noise variance significantly reduces prediction accuracy

key_insights: Linear SCMs are appropriate when relationships are approximately linear (e.g., pricing models)
Nonlinear SCMs (tanh activation) handle complex interactions but require more data
System is robust to moderate misspecification (<20%) but degrades significantly beyond 30%
Exogenous noise variance >0.3 substantially impacts prediction quality
recommendations: Use linear SCMs for well-understood, approximately linear causal relationships
Validate graph structure before deployment to minimize misspecification
Estimate and account for exogenous noise variance in uncertainty quantification
